medications.name: Indomethacin
medications.mechanism: High CNS side effect risk (headache, dizziness)

medications.name: Azithromycin
contraindications: History of cholestatic jaundice with azithromycin

medications.name: Escitalopram

black_box_warning.warning: BLACK BOX: Suicidal ideation in youth

medications.mechanism: BLACK BOX: Suicidal ideation in youth

medications.name: Levothyroxine

black_box_warning.warning: BLACK BOX: Not for obesity/weight loss

medications.mechanism: BLACK BOX: Not for obesity/weight loss

medications.name: Warfarin

black_box_warning.warning: BLEEDING RISK: Can cause major or fatal bleeding. Risk factors include high intensity anticoagulation, age ≥65, highly variable INRs, history of GI bleeding, hypertension, cerebrovascular disease, serious heart disease, anemia, malignancy, trauma, renal insufficiency, concomitant drugs, and long duration of therapy.

medications.mechanism: Inhibits vitamin K-dependent clotting factors (II, VII, IX, X)

medications.name: Clopidogrel

black_box_warning.warning: DIMINISHED EFFECTIVENESS IN POOR METABOLIZERS: Effectiveness depends on activation to an active metabolite by CYP2C19. Poor metabolizers exhibit higher cardiovascular event rates than extensive metabolizers.

medications.mechanism: Inhibits P2Y12 component of ADP receptors on platelets

medications.name: Gabapentin
medications.mechanism: Binds to alpha2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels

medications.name: Prednisone
medications.mechanism: Binds to glucocorticoid receptors, modulates gene transcription

medications.name: Furosemide

black_box_warning.warning: OTOTOXICITY: Furosemide is a potent diuretic which, if given in excessive amounts, can lead to profound diuresis with water and electrolyte depletion. Ototoxicity has been observed with rapid injection.

medications.mechanism: Inhibits Na-K-2Cl cotransporter in thick ascending limb of loop of Henle

interactions.description: Combining Alprazolam with Oxycodone creates profound CNS depression and respiratory depression. FDA BLACK BOX WARNING: Concomitant use can result in profound sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death.
interactions.clinical_effects: Respiratory depression, profound sedation, coma, death, emergency department visits
interactions.recommendation: AVOID COMBINATION. If absolutely necessary, use lowest effective doses of each and monitor continuously. Consider alternative therapies. Educate patient/family on overdose risk.
interactions.source: FDA Black Box Warning, CDC Guidelines

interactions.description: Combining Oxazepam with Tramadol creates profound CNS depression and respiratory depression. FDA BLACK BOX WARNING: Concomitant use can result in profound sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death.
interactions.clinical_effects: Respiratory depression, profound sedation, coma, death, emergency department visits
interactions.recommendation: AVOID COMBINATION. If absolutely necessary, use lowest effective doses of each and monitor continuously. Consider alternative therapies. Educate patient/family on overdose risk.

interactions.description: Warfarin combined with aspirin creates a 7.3-fold increased risk of major bleeding compared to warfarin alone.
interactions.clinical_effects: Major bleeding (GI, intracranial, hematuria), hemorrhagic stroke, fatal bleeding
interactions.recommendation: AVOID COMBINATION unless specifically indicated by cardiologist. If used, maintain INR at lower range (2.0-2.5), use lowest aspirin dose (75-81mg).
interactions.source: FDA Black Box Warning

interactions.description: Fluconazole significantly reduces warfarin metabolism, leading to elevated INR and increased bleeding risk.
interactions.clinical_effects: Elevated INR (>5.0), increased bleeding risk, hemorrhage
interactions.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 25-50% when initiating fluconazole. Monitor INR within 2-3 days.
interactions.source: FDA Drug Interaction Database

interactions.mechanism: NSAID increases bleeding risk through antiplatelet effects
interactions.description: NSAIDs inhibit platelet function and cause GI ulceration, dramatically increasing bleeding risk with warfarin.
interactions.clinical_effects: GI bleeding, increased bruising, hematuria, elevated INR
interactions.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs in warfarin patients. Use acetaminophen for pain. If NSAID necessary, add PPI.
interactions.source: FDA Black Box Warning

interactions.description: Omeprazole prevents conversion of clopidogrel to active metabolite, reducing effectiveness.
interactions.clinical_effects: Reduced antiplatelet effect, increased risk of MI, stent thrombosis
interactions.recommendation: Avoid omeprazole. Use alternative PPI (pantoprazole) or H2 blocker.
interactions.source: FDA Black Box Warning

interactions.mechanism: SSRI + NSAID increases GI bleeding risk
interactions.description: SSRIs deplete platelet serotonin. Combined with NSAID, bleeding risk increases significantly.
interactions.clinical_effects: GI bleeding, bruising, hemorrhage
interactions.recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. Use acetaminophen. If NSAID needed, add PPI protection.
interactions.source: Multiple cohort studies

interactions.description: NSAIDs oppose ACE inhibitor effects and can cause acute kidney injury.
interactions.clinical_effects: Reduced BP control, acute kidney injury, hyperkalemia
interactions.recommendation: Avoid chronic NSAID use. Monitor BP and renal function if combination necessary.
interactions.source: Clinical pharmacology studies

interactions.description: Amlodipine can increase atorvastatin levels moderately.
interactions.clinical_effects: Increased statin myopathy risk, muscle pain
interactions.recommendation: Limit atorvastatin to 20mg daily with amlodipine per FDA guidance.
interactions.source: FDA guidance
